Somebody to help.question: It's what you're made of that counts.

Agree.description: Some people might call you a small-picture thinker; but someone's got to care about each and every point, line, surface and volume that make up the structure.

Disagree.description: For you it isn't the arrangement of the structure, but of the matter itself; who cares that it's the tallest building in the world? It's the concrete core and glass façade that get's you excited.

Or you don't..description: Shallow; for you it's all about the look of a thing. Like the Mona Lisa, you recall every single vestige of the subject, except what it really is.

Or you can pay to get it..description: You're that guy who can't tell refers to car's by their colour; it's all about the style with you.

A magical world of reasonably priced sto.description: Like Kevin McCloud, you believe that paintwork is integral to the structure; and that a building is just a place for you to attach windows and doors.

A hell where new couples go to repent th.description: Forget the abstract- call a spade a spade; you want something you can touch.

The meaning.question: You'd rather settle down with a...

Good book.description: You are the 1000 words that make up a picture; whilst you aren't actually part of the group, you'd still happily explain it all to others.

Lazy film.question: The best holiday is one where you

Wake up at 8 in the morning every day to.description: You are Godzilla! Ploughing straight through structures, exposing internal planes and revealing the hidden details.

Meet the locals.description: Maybe not democratically elected; you take up every cause you can find to make sure they are represented.

Wonder the country side.description: You are Scotland; there isn't a flat square inch of you; continuous undulations, curvatures and peaks.

Puzzle.question: Which of these statements do you most agree with?

There is only right and wrong.description: A neat freak by design- everything has to be in exactly the right place for you; every object aligned, every connection perfect. I expect you'd be a horrific mother-in-law.

It depends where you're standing.description: You light up the lives of others; a source of brightness in an otherwise dark world.

What you do.question: In any battle the side that wins is

The Egg.description: The ultimate enabler- alone you do nothing, but without you nothing else would have meaning.

The Chicken.description: When not engineering, I have no doubt you make a living guessing the number of jelly beans in a jar.

Brazil.description: If you're not the rock, you're the hard place. Where other people give solutions, all you give is problems. But let's be fair- without you and your boundaries the whole project would just spiral out of control.

2001: A Space Oddessy.description: You are the ultimate original thinker; everything else is just a devivation of your ideas.

Scott Pilgrim.description: Quis definit ipsos definition? You do; You've gone beyond self-referential to meta.

The side with the best weapons.question: The best thing at a theme park are

The F1 Driver.description: For you the whole really is the sum of it's parts- there's no such thing as a structure, just a collection of beams and slabs.

The F1 Engineering Team.description: A champion of the under represented, you know that it's the hidden pieces of an organisation that keep it all together.

The ghost house.question: What makes a good car great?

Bumper stickers.description: Just how many bangles are you wearing? For you, a structure is just something you can accessorize!

Leather upholstery.description: Master of feng shue- your aim in life is to record group and arrange the assets within a the structure.

Sub-woofer in the boot.description: Like Q from James Bond, your aim in life is to gadetise structures with soo many sensors that Wallace and Gromit would be proud!

Queen – Bohemian Raphasody.description: Like the many adonis' that befould the beachs of California- you just go with the flow.

Electric Six - “Danger! High Voltage”.description: I expect you're at the Gym pretty often- because you're all about the power. Oh you might do a little bit of communication on the side, but your true love is the spark.

Earth, Wind & Fire – September.description: Never too hot, never too cold- you spend the whole of your life making sure that other's are comfortable.

Billy Joel – We Didn't Start The Fire.description: You like the make a splash, but behind your “fun” exteriour is a sensible interiour that you use to keep others safe when you have to.

7 Highly Effective Habbits Of Highly Eff.question: Why do the government always get things wrong?

Like minded people can share and develop.description: The ultimate in Bureaucracy; you are almost all red tape and no information.

Good ideas go to die.description: When people say “somebody really ought to sought this out” they mean you.

They don't use the right processes..question: If a tree falls in a forest, does it make a sound?

Yes.description: Like Barak Obama- You are a force for change.

No.description: You have daddy issues- approval is everything to you. You've defined yourself on what other people think, not just of you, but of everything else. But that doesn't stop you from being judgemental; not part of a project is free of your scrutiny.

Only if I told it to..description: You are a control freak- you need to control every single bit of the project.

If we just got on a did some work.description: A number cruncher at heart, you'd rather corrolate the relationship between pigment density and watch-duration than appreicate the art.

We asked everyone what they think.description: You are, quite literally, outside of the box. Forever reaching beyond the project to find new sources of information.

In the good old days.description: You are living in the past; obsessed with the history of the structure.

If people would just do what I say.description: You're self-obsessed, there's no getting around it. All you ever want to do is tell people about yourself, the company you work for and your relationships to others.

Time is Money.description: You know the cost of everything and the value of nothing. You'd sit in front of a design for the most beautiful structure on earth, capable of uniting man-kind, and ask “yes, but could we do it for half the price”?

Money Is Time.description: You live in the forth dimension; having taken punctuality to a new level- you count the seconds and know the date of completion before the first concrete pour has even started.
